Dear Mack McGhee:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan must be completed and routed in CWLM.
A six-month provisional license is recommended. You must contest or agree to the
issuance of a provisional license in writing on the CWL-4617. If you do not submit the
CWL-4617 the recommendation will be treated as contested. Even if you contest the
issuance of a provisional license, you must still submit an acceptable corrective action
plan. If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to
contact me.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Rorie Dodge-Pifer, at 517-899-6024.
Sincerely,
Vivian D Malleck, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 07/28/2025, a youth hit a staff member and as a result, the
staff member struck the youth multiple times with a closed fist.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was interviewed on 07/31/2025 with another
Department of Health and Human Service (DHHS) Worker.
Complainant did not have additional information.
Youth A was interviewed on 07/31/2025 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with another DHHS Worker. Youth A stated
assistance was called to Unit 3A for a physical altercation. Youth
A stated Crisis Response Team (CRT) staff arrived on the unit
and a CRT staff (does not know his name) ran up to him and
slammed him onto the ground. Youth A stated he got up and
swung at this CRT staff. Youth A stated CRT 2 secured him in a
primary restraint technique (PRT) hold and the unknown CRT staff
hit Youth A twice on the right side of his face. Youth A stated the
unknown CRT staff also pulled Youth A to the ground by pulling
on Youth A’s braids located on the left side of Youth A’s head.
Youth A stated he had blurry vision, and his head and neck hurt
from this incident with unknown CRT staff. Youth A stated he was
evaluated by the nurse, given Motrin, and taken to Children’s
Hospital for an evaluation.
Youth B was interviewed on 07/31/2025 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with another DHHS Worker. Youth B stated he
was in a fighting mood because he had a “bad phone call.” Youth
B stated he ran into Youth D’s room when the door was open and
swung at Youth D because he kept alleging someone was moving
the towel over his room door window when he wanted to use the
toilet. Youth B stated CRT staff responded to their physical
altercation. Youth B stated CRT 3 placed Youth B in a PRT in the
common area and CRT 4 tried to assist CRT 3. Youth B stated he
bit CRT 4’s arm and CRT 4 scratched Youth B’s face. Youth B
2

stated Youth A tried to get Youth B out of the PRT but a CRT staff
(does not know his name) secured Youth A in a PRT. Youth B
stated he does not know what else occurred with Youth A
because he was involved in his own physical management. Youth
B was observed with several small scratch marks that broke skin
above his left jawline.
Youth C was interviewed on 07/31/2025 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with another DHHS Worker. Youth C stated
Youth D caused tension on the unit by alleging a youth was
moving the towel covering his room door window. Youth C stated
Youth B said he moved the towel and then ran into Youth D’s
room. Youth C stated Staff 1 entered Youth D's room and stopped
the physical altercation between Youth B and Youth D. Youth C
stated CRT staff came to the unit. Youth C stated Youth A and
Youth B wanted to “jump” Youth D but a CRT staff (does not know
his name) secured Youth B and another CRT staff (does not know
his name) secured Youth A. Youth C stated he saw a CRT staff
(does not know his name) punch Youth A in the face. Youth C
stated unit staff (does not recall who) redirected the youths to
stand by their room door or enter their room. Youth C stated Youth
A went to the hospital for a possible concussion from a CRT staff
hitting him.
Youth D was interviewed on 07/31/2025 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with another DHHS Worker. Youth D stated he
asked who was pulling down the towel covering his room door
window when he wanted to use the toilet. Youth D stated Youth B
owned up to pulling the towel and ran into Youth D’s room when
the room door was opened. Youth D stated he and Youth B
started to fight until Staff 1 entered the room and separated them.
Youth D stated Staff 1 redirected Youth B to exit the room and
Youth B swung again at Youth D without connecting. Youth D
stated he and Youth B ran around the unit until he got a hold of
Youth B. Youth D stated Staff 1 separated Youth B and Youth D
and CRT staff arrived on the unit. Youth D stated CRT 3 escorted
Youth D to the sink area and Youth A and Youth C started to taunt
CRT staff by saying, “What you going to do?” Youth D stated unit
staff and CRT staff redirected youths to stand by their doors, but
Youth A and Youth B moved around the unit. Youth D stated he
stood by his room door and saw Youth A hit CRT 1 and push a
CRT staff (does not recall who). Youth D stated a CRT staff (does
not recall who) pushed Youth A against a wall as CRT staff (does
not recall who) secured Youth B in a corner. Youth D stated Youth
A was placed in a PRT by a CRT staff (does not recall who) and
CRT 1 punched Youth A’s face.
3

CRT 1 was interviewed on 08/15/2025 by phone. CRT 1 stated he
resigned from Wayne County Juvenile Detention on 07/29/2025.
CRT 1 stated he did not want to be interviewed without his
incident report. CRT 1 agreed to his incident report being read to
him for confirmation of the incident. After listening to the incident
report, CRT 1 stated he wrote it, and it was an accurate account of
the incident. CRT 1 was asked if he had additional comments.
CRT 1 stated once Youth A was placed in his room, Youth A
applauded and with a menacing grin and said, “Let’s get it 3200.”
CRT 1 also stated his left hand was injured during this incident but
does not recall how. (See Documents Reviewed for a summary of
CRT 1’s incident report.)
CRT 2 was interviewed on 08/07/2025 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention with another DHHS Worker. CRT 2 stated he
responded to an assistance call on Unit 3A and assisted by
placing youths in their rooms. CRT 2 stated Youth A was “riled up”
and yelled, “Let’s get it popping!” CRT 2 stated Youth A took off
his shirt and tried to push CRT 2. CRT 2 stated he redirected
Youth A to step into his room, but Youth A kicked his room door
shut and ran to the other side of the unit. CRT 2 stated he heard
commotion and ran to the other side of the unit. CRT 2 stated he
saw Youth A facing CRT 1 with his fists up and throwing a punch.
CRT 2 stated he placed Youth A in a PRT and felt some type of
impact between Youth A and CRT 1. CRT 2 stated he moved
Youth A to another area and placed him in an empty room until
the unit was restored for processing of this incident.
CRT 3 was interviewed on 08/07/2025 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention with another DHHS Worker. CRT 3 stated Youth B tried
to assault Youth D and caused the other youths to become
excited. CRT 3 stated Youth B swung at CRT 4 with his fists. CRT
3 stated CRT 4 tried to place Youth B in a PRT but Youth B kept
moving and swinging his arms and tried to put CRT 4 in a
headlock. CRT 3 stated he intervened and placed Youth B in a
PRT and CRT 4 stepped aside. CRT 3 stated from his peripheral
vision he saw Youth A move aggressively towards CRT 1. CRT 3
stated he heard a youth say, “Oh my god, he hit him, he actually
hit him.” CRT 3 stated he did not witness any hitting contact
between Youth A and CRT 1.
CRT 4 was interviewed on 08/07/2025 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention with another DHHS Worker. CRT 4 stated he
responded to an assistance call on Unit 3A and found Youth B
trying to get to a youth (does not know youth’s name) as the other
4

youths became excited. CRT 4 stated he placed Youth B in a PRT
but Youth B swung and punched him. CRT 4 stated Youth B spit
and bit CRT 4’s left forearm, which resulted in CRT 3 taking over
and securing Youth B in a PRT. CRT 4 stated Youth A ran up to
Youth B, CRT 4, and CRT 1 and tried to intervene. CRT 4 stated
he was focused on Youth B and CRT 3 and did not witness
anything between Youth A and CRT 1.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 08/07/2025 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention with another DHHS Worker. Staff 1 stated Youth B ran
into Youth D’s room when Staff 1 left Youth D’s room to get him
toilet tissue. Staff 1 stated he separated Youth B and Youth D and
began to de-escalate them when CRT staff arrived. Staff 1 stated
Youth A became excited once CRT arrived. Staff 1 stated a CRT
staff pulled Youth A's hair from the top of his head and another
CRT placed Youth A in a PRT. Staff 1 stated Youth A yelled, “Let
me go!” Staff 1 stated a CRT staff was directed to leave the unit
by another CRT staff. Staff 1 stated he was focused on “crowd
control” when he heard youths say that a CRT staff hit Youth A.
Staff 1 stated he does not know the names of CRT staff.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 08/12/2025 by phone. Staff 2 stated
CRT staff responded to an assistance call when Youth B ran into
Youth D’s room and started a physical altercation. Staff 2 stated
Youth B was secured by CRT staff by the counselor’s office door
and tried to break free of the hold. Staff 2 stated Youth A ran up to
a CRT staff and yelled “What up?” Staff 2 stated a CRT staff
secured Youth A in a PRT and another CRT staff hit Youth A twice
in the face and pulled the side of Youth A’s hair. Staff 2 stated
Youth A fought back and yelled at the CRT staff. Staff 2 stated
unit staff assist CRT staff by redirecting the youths to stand by
their doors during escalated situations until the incident can be
processed. Staff 2 stated she does not know the names of CRT
staff.
Staff 3 was interviewed on 08/12/2025 by phone. Staff 3 stated
assistance was called for a physical altercation between two
youths (does not recall which youths). Staff 3 stated Youth A
became confrontational and antagonized one of the CRT staff
(does not his name). Staff 3 stated she was surprised when she
saw this CRT grab Youth A’s hair. Staff 3 stated she did not
witness anything further with Youth A because she was busy
separating youths and redirecting youths to stand by their doors to
settle down the unit.
5

Video
Unit 3A 07/28/2025 video footage was reviewed from multiple
camera angles. Video footage does not record sound. It shows
Youth D standing in his room with the door open. Youth B runs
into Youth D’s room. Staff 1 moves from the staff bathroom and
enters Youth D’s room. Youth B and Youth D exit the room and
swing at each other in the common area. CRT arrives on the unit.
Youth B pushes and swings at CRT 4. CRT 4 attempts to place
Youth B in a PRT with the assistance of CRT 3. Youth A kicks a
room door shut with CRT 2 standing at the door and runs up to
Youth B, CRT 3, and CRT 4 in the common area. CRT 1 runs
after Youth A and they collide into the wall and fall to the ground
with CRT 1 landing on top of Youth A. CRT 1 and Youth A
immediately get up and face each other with their arms bent to
punch. Youth A swings at CRT 1. CRT 2 runs over from the other
side and secures Youth A in a PRT. CRT 1 faces Youth A and
swings his left hand twice at Youth A’s face. CRT 2 steps back
with Youth A and CRT 1 pushes Youth A and CRT 2 back against
the wall. CRT 2 turns Youth A away but CRT 1 follows with his
left-hand holding Youth A’s hair on the left side and pushes them
before releasing his hold.
Documentation Reviewed
Summary of CRT 1’s written incident report dated 07/28/2025.
CRT 1 entered Unit 3A around 16:48 for an assistance call.
Youths were running and yelling while a staff was attempting to
keep two youths separated. Youth A walked behind the staff desk
and pushed CRT 2’s back and took a fighting stance before
leaving. Youth A approached CRT 1 and yelled, “What’s up nigga!
Let’s get it popping! You a bitch!” Youth A’s hands were clenched
and he lunged towards CRT 1. CRT 1 redirected Youth A about
personal space and Youth A moved away and “skip and prance”
around the unit. CRT 4 attempted to de-escalate Youth B but
Youth B swung his arms at CRT 4. CRT 4 attempted to physically
manage Youth B and Youth A attempted to intervene. CRT 1 tried
to physically secure Youth A and they fell to the ground. CRT 1
disengaged and Youth A threw a punch that did not connect after
they stood up. CRT 1 hit Youth A in the face twice with a closed
fist “in response to the perceived threat and in a moment of
heightened stress”. CRT 1 wrote that this was not protocol and he
separated himself from the incident.
CRT 1 had Handle with Care training on 06/26/2025 and
07/08/2025. CRT 1 does not have a discipline history.
6

Youth A’s medical documentation states Youth A was seen by
nursing staff on 07/28/2025 because he was hit on the right side
of his head and the back of his head and neck. Youth A’s pupils
were equal and round and responsive to light and he was alert
and oriented. Youth A stated he vomited twice and complained of
headache but denied loss of consciousness. Youth A was sent to
Children’s Hospital of Michigan on 07/28/2025 to rule out a
concussion. Children’s Hospital of Michigan diagnosed Youth A
with a closed head injury (concussion). Youth A was seen by
nursing staff on 07/29/2025 for follow up. Youth A was alert and
oriented with a steady gait.
Youth B’s medical documentation states Youth B was seen by
nursing staff on 07/28/2025. Youth B had a scratch on his right
shoulder, lip, and left side of his face without bleeding, swelling, or
pain. Youth B’s scratch marks were cleaned and bacitracin was
applied.
Wayne County Juvenile Detention is approved to utilize Handle
with Care physical management model.
Unit Layout
Unit 3A is shaped like the letter H. Youth bedrooms, showers and
office space surround the common area in the vertical lines of the
letter H. In the horizontal line of the letter H is the unit gym and
across from the gym is a staff desk area. The unit classroom is
located behind the staff desk.
Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance because CRT 1 admits to
hitting Youth A’s head on 07/28/2025. This is supported through
several interviews, CRT 1’s incident report and video footage. It
cannot be determined if the scratch marks on Youth B were from
his altercation with Youth D or from his physical management with
CRT 4.
Technical Assistance
Physical management policy and procedure is to state that any
type of physical punishment including, but not limited to: hitting or
striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a youth on any part
of their body is prohibited.
Conclusion REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED

is recommended that the license be modified to a First Provisional license.
